q: interview excerpt from " Colin Powell , President Bush 's first secretary of state, "did not, in my view, do a good job of managing the people under him," Donald Rumsfeld said. " There was a lot of leaking out of the State Department, and the president knew it, he said. "And it was unhelpful. And most of it ended up making the State Department look good. We didn't do that in the Pentagon. I insisted we not do it."

Bill Lockyer , California's state treasurer, participated in a national telephonic news conference with EPI officials, to denounce the bankruptcy concept. No state needs to declare bankruptcy, Bill Lockyer said, "The states have sovereign taxing power the big companies don't." Bill Lockyer 's point- a valid one- is that bankruptcy is the refuge for individuals, corporations and local governments

Perhaps not surprisingly, Donald Rumsfeld by no means suggests that the war itself was a mistake. He holds to the theory that had the coalition forces not toppled Saddam Hussein , the whole region would be far more perilous than it is today . As for his own style of presentation, he was guilty of quips, he admits now, that would have been better unsaid, including "stuff happens" in reference to mass looting in Baghdad
